name: Energy-Flow Cosmology (EFC) Core and Extended Concepts
description: A unified thermodynamic framework connecting cosmic structure, dynamics, and cognition through energy flow and entropy.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Cosmology (EFC)
hasDefinedTerm.description: The foundational thermodynamic framework unifying cosmic structure, dynamics, and cognition through the interaction between energy flow (Ef) and entropy (S).

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Potential (Ef)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Defines the energetic potential governing thermodynamic curvature, time evolution, and the emergence of structure.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Entropy Gradient (∇S)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Represents the direction of increasing disorder and the arrow of time; the driver of energy redistribution and structure formation.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Grid–Higgs Framework (GHF)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Describes the coupling between the universal energy grid and the Higgs field, forming the structural basis for spacetime and mass distribution.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Halo Model of Entropy (HME)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Explains how entropy gradients generate and stabilize galactic halos without dark matter, linking thermodynamic imbalance to gravitational behavior.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Interface (EFI)
hasDefinedTerm.description: A unified thermodynamic interpretation of dark matter, dark energy, and the CMB within the Grid–Higgs framework.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Dynamics (EFD)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Describes cosmic expansion, gravitation, and time as emergent properties of energy-rate density and entropy flow.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Thermodynamic Curvature
hasDefinedTerm.description: Defines spacetime curvature as a thermodynamic property emerging from variations in the energy-flow potential and entropy density.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Rayleigh Dissipation Functional
hasDefinedTerm.description: Describes energy dissipation mechanisms within non-equilibrium thermodynamic systems, essential to EFC’s dynamic stability.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Lyapunov Stability in EFC
hasDefinedTerm.description: Specifies the stability criteria for energy-flow field evolution; ensures convergence to equilibrium or steady-state attractors.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Informational Metastructure Extension (IMX)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Defines the informational architecture linking energy flow, entropy, and cognition. Extends EFC into the semantic and cognitive domain.

hasDefinedTerm.name: CEM-Cosmos
hasDefinedTerm.description: A field-theoretic model of consciousness coupled to Energy-Flow Cosmology, extending thermodynamic logic to cognitive systems.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Cross-Domain Vector Convergence (CDVC)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Describes resonance and synchronization between physical, informational, and cognitive domains within the EFC framework.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Validation Ledger
hasDefinedTerm.description: Provides a structured comparison between EFC predictions and observational data (JWST, DESI, Planck), offering an empirical validation framework.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Entropy–Light Speed Relationship
hasDefinedTerm.description: Explores how variations in entropy density affect the local propagation speed of light, redefining c as an emergent thermodynamic property.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Halo Hypothesis
hasDefinedTerm.description: A derivative of the Halo Model of Entropy proposing that gravitational halos are emergent entropic equilibria, not mass anomalies.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Comprehensive Introduction – Energy-Flow Cosmology (EFC)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Comprehensive overview of the Energy-Flow Cosmology framework, including its thermodynamic foundations, cross-domain structure, and validation logic.
